urls.title: CoViD vaccines and thrombotic events: EMA issued warning to patients and healthcare professionals - Journal of Pharmaceutical Policy and Practice
urls.description: There have been recent reports of haemorrhage, blood clots and thrombocytopenia following administration of CoViD-19 vaccines that have raised concerns over the safety of genetic vaccines for people with pre-existing coagulation disorders or those on certain medications. This had also led to temporary suspension of Oxford/AZ CoViD vaccine in a number of countries across Europe [1]. As a result, Medicine and Healthcare Regulatory Authority, UK (MHRA) and European Medicines Agency (EMA) initiated a

urls.title: CoViD vaccines and thrombotic events: EMA issued warning to patients and healthcare professionals - Journal of Pharmaceutical Policy and Practice
urls.description: There have been recent reports of haemorrhage, blood clots and thrombocytopenia following administration of CoViD-19 vaccines that have raised concerns over the safety of genetic vaccines for people with pre-existing coagulation disorders or those on certain medications. urls.title: CoViD vaccines and thrombotic events: EMA issued warning to patients and healthcare professionals - Journal of Pharmaceutical Policy and Practice
urls.description: There have been recent reports of haemorrhage, blood clots and thrombocytopenia following administration of CoViD-19 vaccines that have raised concerns over the safety of genetic vaccines for people with pre-existing coagulation disorders or those on certain medications. This had also led to temporary suspension of Oxford/AZ CoViD vaccine in a number of countries across Europe [1]. As a result, Medicine and Healthcare Regulatory Authority, UK (MHRA) and European Medicines Agency (EMA) initiated a
